text: Hey there Head Squeezers, I hope you're well.

I've been really looking forward to this one,
it comes in via YouTube from hsusan802 who
asks Can Animals Taste?

Well the simple answer is yes and there are
loads of members of the animal kingdom who
have more sensitive sense of taste than us.

Give us a thumbs up if your life wouldn't
be complete without the taste of a Friday
evening curry or a lovely Sunday lunch.
But what is taste?

It is essentially it is the ability to perceive
the impact of molecules through your nose
or your tongue.

Because on your tongue there is a whole load
of taste buds and each taste bud is kindof

like a little bucket, and moving molecules
fall into that bucket and they get picked

up by nerve endings and that sends a signal
to your brain which you receive as taste.

Anything which makes those molecules move
around more freely like heat will intensify
the taste.

Just think of the difference between a plate
of hot chips and some cold chips.
But we don't just eat for pleasure.

Eating helps us and animals work out what
is a good source of energy.

We don't want to eat something poisonous or
rotten that may damage us.
Let's have a look at a lion.

A lion has about 470 taste buds all he needs
to eat is meat and he just needs to know whether
it's rancid or not.

A human has around 10,000 taste buds because
we eat, vegetables, fruit, grain, we eat all

sorts of things and we probably sense 5 different
flavours, 6, 7, 8, anyway that's a whole new
film, send in that question.
Anyway, what about a pig?

A pig is an omnivore, it's got about 15,000
taste buds, but to find the leader of the

pack we need to go deep down into the ocean
and look at the catfish.

Not the prettiest of amphibians I think you'll
agree but it can have up to 175,000 taste

buds, mainly over its gill arches and its
barbells, their four fleshy whiskers.

And those taste buds are all over its body,
the reason for that is that it spend it's

time down in murky muddy waters so that is
how it perceives it's environment so it can
find it's way around.
Pretty cool.

Now the animal right down at the bottom of
the pecking order with 20- 30 taste buds is
the humble chicken.
The one I like to have on my Sunday dinner.
Sorry buddy.

Now if you like animal related questions we've
done a whole bunch here on Head Squeeze from

Do Dolphin's Sleep to Are Zebra's White with
Black Stripes or Black with White Stripes?
A classic.

So go and check out one of those and until
next time happy Head Squeezing.
